channel.title: I been thinking
channel.description:
Theres been shit load people saying over the years they been hacked and noone seem to be able to stop it.
So what about if we make a Hwid login. What does that mean? The Hwid would create a unigue ID number of your computer and that number will be automatic enabled on our DB or Hwid recovery. That means you can only login from the computer you created the hwid with.
Heres more info; http://aspen.ucs.indiana.edu/project/gxos/apidocs/commgrids/schema/HWID.html Exemple class; http://pastebin.com/yL9YsGu6
Discuss.

item.title: I been thinking
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

Modify Blizzard’s midlet authenticator and make players use that on your server

Read full topic

item.title: I been thinking
item.dc:creator: @The_Enforcer The Enforcer
item.description:
@The_Enforcer wrote:

  1. It would tie your players to be able to use one machine only.
  2. Any type of authentication system in Java is crackable in ~10 minutes for someone who’s experienced in reverse engineering. Basing account recovery on HWID would be a really bad idea.

Read full topic

item.title: I been thinking
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

This would be a good way to log users (who has how many accounts), until someone figures out you’re doing it.

Read full topic

item.title: I been thinking
item.dc:creator: @Intoxication Intoxication
item.description:
@Intoxication wrote:

Some users use different computers to play.

(N).

Read full topic
